<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><Highlight kind="comment">//===-LTOCodeGenerator.h - LLVM Link Time Optimizer -----------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This file declares the LTOCodeGenerator class.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   LTO compilation consists of three phases: Pre-IPO, IPO and Post-IPO.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   The Pre-IPO phase compiles source code into bitcode file. The resulting</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bitcode files, along with object files and libraries, will be fed to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// linker to through the IPO and Post-IPO phases. By using obj-file extension,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the resulting bitcode file disguises itself as an object file, and therefore</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// obviates the need of writing a special set of the make-rules only for LTO</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compilation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   The IPO phase perform inter-procedural analyses and optimizations, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the Post-IPO consists two sub-phases: intra-procedural scalar optimizations</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (SOPT), and intra-procedural target-dependent code generator (CG).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   As of this writing, we don&#39;t separate IPO and the Post-IPO SOPT. They</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are intermingled together, and are driven by a single pass manager (see</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PassManagerBuilder::populateLTOPassManager()).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   FIXME: populateLTOPassManager no longer exists.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   The &quot;LTOCodeGenerator&quot; is the driver for the IPO and Post-IPO stages.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The &quot;CodeGenerator&quot; here is bit confusing. Don&#39;t confuse the &quot;CodeGenerator&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the machine specific code generator.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Restore linkage of globals</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// When set, the linkage of globals will be restored prior to code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// generation. That is, a global symbol that had external linkage prior to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LTO will be emitted with external linkage again; and a local will remain</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// local. Note that this option only affects the end result - globals may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// still be internalized in the process of LTO and may be modified and/or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// deleted where legal.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The default behavior will internalize globals (unless on the preserve</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// list) and, if parallel code generation is enabled, will externalize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// all locals.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ltocodegenerator/#af08f01d6b672143c1225085a731868be"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ltocodegenerator/#af08f01d6b672143c1225085a731868be">setShouldRestoreGlobalsLinkage</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">    ShouldRestoreGlobalsLinkage = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ltocodegenerator/#a32cfe4929393f5d065a15fdd18a17a43"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ltocodegenerator/#a32cfe4929393f5d065a15fdd18a17a43">addMustPreserveSymbol</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Sym) &#123; MustPreserveSymbols.insert(Sym); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Pass options to the driver and optimization passes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These options are not necessarily for debugging purpose (the function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// name is misleading).  This function should be called before</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LTOCodeGenerator::compilexxx(), and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LTOCodeGenerator::writeMergedModules().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// true on success.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Calls \\a verifyMergedModuleOnce().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compile the merged module into a &#42;single&#42; output file; the path to output</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// file is returned to the caller via argument &quot;name&quot;. Return true on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// success.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\note It is up to the linker to remove the intermediate output file.  Do</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not try to remove the object file in LTOCodeGenerator&#39;s destructor as we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// don&#39;t who (LTOCodeGenerator or the output file) will last longer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ltocodegenerator/#a27d611481aad540d852ba2c91587bd54">compile&#95;to&#95;file</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;&#42;Name);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// As with compile&#95;to&#95;file(), this function compiles the merged module into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// single output file. Instead of returning the output file path to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// caller (linker), it brings the output to a buffer, and returns the buffer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to the caller. This function should delete the intermediate file once</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// its content is brought to memory. Return NULL if the compilation was not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// successful.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;MemoryBuffer&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ltocodegenerator/#a0b0094212f9cb4bcbe1b3c39b2785e55">compile</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
